DOC.brief_summary: OBJECTIVES/BACKGROUND : We seek determine early diagnostic value new high sensitive cardiac troponin T assay ( TnThs ) suspect acute coronary syndrome ( ACS ) compare 4th generation cTnT assay manufacturer , myoglobin heart-type fatty acid bind protein ( h-FABP ) . METHODS : The study consist 94 patient chest pain admit chest pain unit diagnosis suspect ACS without ST-Elevation . Patients divide accord time onset symptom presentation early presenter group ( < 4 hour ) late presenter group ( â‰¥4 hour ) . A median 6 sample ( range 2-8 ) available per patient . The diagnostic performance TnThs assess use ROC analysis area curve ( AUC ) baseline follow-up result TnThs , cTnT , myoglobin , h-FABP compare use c-statistics . RESULTS : The TnThs assay allow excellent prediction non-ST-segment-elevation myocardial infarction ( non-STEMI ) presentation.A follow-up sample improve diagnostic performance time dependent manner . The AUC TnThs superior cTnT time point . CONCLUSIONS : A baseline sample TnThs allow early prediction non-STEMI less sensitive precise 4th generation cTnT assay . The excellent performance TnThs baseline follow-up might obviate need early necrosis marker .
DOC.criteria: consecutive patient ACS Patients STsegment elevation presentation exclude patient muscular trauma , severe kidney dysfunction define estimate glomerular filtration rate 60 ml/min/1.73m2 . In addition patient underwent percutaneous coronary intervention followup sample also exclude
